sentences.english: All three are in very poor circumstances.
The result is not good, the family circumstances are poor, receives the human to bully frequently.
sentences.chinese: 成績不好，家境貧寒，經常受人欺負。

sentences.english: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，貧寒的人有指望，罪孽之輩必塞口無言。

sentences.english: He will take pity on the weak and the needy and save the needy from death.
sentences.chinese: 他要憐恤貧寒和窮乏的人，拯救窮苦人的性命。

sentences.english: He was born into humble circumstances in St. Petersburg in 1952.
sentences.chinese: 他1952年出生在彼得堡的一個貧寒之家。

sentences.english: I am a countryman born in a poor family and have been remembering my identity as a farmer.
sentences.chinese: 我本鄉野人，出身貧寒家，至今不忘卻，自己是農民。

sentences.english: Indeed, poverty reduction has leveled off in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 的確，貧寒減少近幾年來已經平飛。

sentences.english: Great men have often risen from poverty -- Lincoln and Edison, for example.
sentences.chinese: 大人物常常出身貧寒，例如林肯和愛迪生。

sentences.english: His family was so poor that he couldn"t go to school."
sentences.chinese: 因爲家道貧寒，他不克不及上課。

sentences.english: Sun Simiao was born in an ordinary peasant family, the family was very poor.
sentences.chinese: 孫思邈出生在一個普通的農民家庭裏，家境十分貧寒。

sentences.english: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth the needy out of the dunghill;
sentences.chinese: 他從灰塵裏擡舉貧寒人，從糞堆中提拔窮乏人。

sentences.english: Deliver the poor and needy: rid them out of the hand of the wicked.
sentences.chinese: 當保護貧寒和窮乏的人，救他們脫離惡人的手。

sentences.english: He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls of the needy.
sentences.chinese: 他要憐恤貧寒和窮乏的人，拯救窮苦人的性命。

sentences.english: His family was so poor that he couldn't go to school.
sentences.chinese: 由於家境貧寒，他不能上學。

sentences.english: Most are poor, and live in developing countries.
sentences.chinese: 大多數人處境貧寒並且生活在發展中國家。

sentences.english: Haydn, the son of poor parents, had been a choir boy in VIENNA Cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 海頓出身貧寒，曾當過維也納大教堂唱詩班的歌童。

definition: to have lost both one's parents
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
